467.bns_description: Whoever forges a document which purports to be a valuable security or a will, or an authority to adopt a son, or which purports to give authority to any person to make or transfer any valuable security, or to receive the principal, interest or dividends thereon, or to receive or deliver any money, movable property, or valuable security, or any document purporting to be an acquittance or receipt acknowledging the payment of money, or an acquittance or receipt for the delivery of any movable property or valuable security, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

468.ipc_description: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document or electronic record forged shall be used for the purpose of cheating, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.
468.bns_description: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document or electronic record forged shall be used for the purpose of cheating, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

471.ipc_title: Using as genuine a forged document or electronic record
471.ipc_description: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine any document or electronic record which he knows or has reason to believe to be a forged document or electronic record, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had forged such document or electronic record.
471.bns_title: Forged document or electronic record and using it as genuine
471.bns_description: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine any document or electronic record which he knows or has reason to believe to be a forged document or electronic record, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had forged such document or electronic record.

482.ipc_title: Punishment for using a false property mark
482.ipc_description: Whoever marks any movable property or goods or any case, package, covering or wrapper with any mark thereon in a manner reasonably calculated to cause it to be believed that the property or goods so marked belong to, or are the manufacture of, or merchandise of, a person to whom, as a trader, such mark does not belong, and such act is done with intent to defraud, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
482.bns_description: Whoever marks any movable property or goods or any case, package, covering or wrapper with any mark thereon in a manner reasonably calculated to cause it to be believed that the property or goods so marked belong to, or are the manufacture of, or merchandise of, a person to whom, as a trader, such mark does not belong, and such act is done with intent to defraud, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

494.ipc_title: Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife
494.ipc_description: Whoever, having a husband or wife living, marries in any case in which such marriage is void by reason of its taking place during the life of such husband or wife, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine. Exception.—This section does not extend to any person whose marriage with such husband or wife has been declared void by a Court of competent jurisdiction, nor to any person who contracts a marriage during the life of a former husband or wife, if such husband or wife, at the time of the subsequent marriage, shall have been continually absent from such person for the space of seven years, and shall not have been heard of by such person as being alive within that time provided the person contracting such subsequent marriage shall, before such marriage takes place, inform the person with whom such marriage is contracted of the real state of facts so far as the same are within his or her knowledge.
494.bns_title: Enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman
494.bns_description: Whoever takes or entices away or detains with intent to marry any woman who is and whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the wife of any other man, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

498.ipc_title: Enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman
498.ipc_description: Whoever takes or entices away any woman who is and whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the wife of any other man, from that man, or from any person having the care of her on behalf of that man, with intent that she may have illicit intercourse with any person, or conceals or detains with that intent any such woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
498.bns_title: Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty
498.bns_description: Whoever, being the husband or the relative of the husband of a woman, subjects such woman to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine. Explanation.—For the purpose of this section, 'cruelty' means— (a) any wilful conduct which is of such a nature as is likely to drive the woman to commit suicide or to cause grave injury or danger to life, limb or health (whether mental or physical) of the woman; or (b) harassment of the woman where such harassment is with a view to coercing her or any person related to her to meet any unlawful demand for any property or valuable security or is on account of failure by her or any person related to her to meet such demand.

498A.ipc_title: Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty
498A.ipc_description: Whoever, being the husband or the relative of the husband of a woman, subjects such woman to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine. Explanation.—For the purpose of this section, 'cruelty' means— (a) any wilful conduct which is of such a nature as is likely to drive the woman to commit suicide or to cause grave injury or danger to life, limb or health (whether mental or physical) of the woman; or (b) harassment of the woman where such harassment is with a view to coercing her or any person related to her to meet any unlawful demand for any property or valuable security or is on account of failure by her or any person related to her to meet such demand.
498A.bns_title: Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty
498A.bns_description: Whoever, being the husband or the relative of the husband of a woman, subjects such woman to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine.

5.ipc_title: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
5.ipc_description: Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of any Act for punishing mutiny and desertion of officers, soldiers, sailors or airmen in the service of the Government of India or shall affect any provision of any Act in force at the time when the Act came into force.
5.bns_description: Nothing in this Sanhita shall affect the provisions of any Act for punishing mutiny and desertion of officers, soldiers, sailors or airmen in the service of the Government of India or shall affect any provision of any Act in force at the time when the Sanhita came into force.

500.ipc_description: Whoever defames another shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
500.bns_description: Whoever defames another shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

504.ipc_title: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace
504.ipc_description: Whoever intentionally insults, and thereby gives provocation to any person, intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause him to break the public peace, or to commit any other offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.
504.bns_title: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace
504.bns_description: Whoever intentionally insults, and thereby gives provocation to any person, intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause him to break the public peace, or to commit any other offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

506.ipc_description: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both, and if the threat be to cause death or grievous hurt, or to cause the destruction of any property by fire, or to cause an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment for a term which may extend to seven years, or to impute unchastity to a woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.
506.bns_description: Whoever threatens another with any injury to his person, reputation or property, or to the person or reputation of any one in whom that person is interested, with intent to cause alarm to that person, or to cause him to do any act which he is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do any act which he is legally entitled to do, as the means of avoiding the execution of such threat, commits criminal intimidation. Punishment: imprisonment up to two years, or fine, or both; if threat to cause death or grievous hurt, up to seven years, or fine, or both.

509.ipc_title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
509.ipc_description: Whoever, intending to insult the modesty of any woman, utters any word, makes any sound or gesture, or exhibits any object, intending that such word or sound shall be heard, or that such gesture or object shall be seen, by such woman, or intrudes upon the privacy of such woman, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and also with fine.
509.bns_title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
509.bns_description: Whoever, intending to insult the modesty of any woman, utters any word, makes any sound or gesture, or exhibits any object, intending that such word or sound shall be heard, or that such gesture or object shall be seen, by such woman, or intrudes upon the privacy of such woman, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and also with fine.

511.ipc_title: Punishment for attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment
511.ipc_description: Whoever attempts to commit an offence punishable by this Code with imprisonment for life or imprisonment, or to cause such an offence to be committed, and in such attempt does any act towards the commission of the offence, shall, where no express provision is made by this Code for the punishment of such attempt, be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-half of the imprisonment for life or, as the case may be, one-half of the longest term of imprisonment provided for that offence, or with such fine as is provided for the offence, or with both.
511.bns_title: Punishment for attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment
511.bns_description: Whoever attempts to commit an offence punishable by this Sanhita with imprisonment for life or imprisonment, or to cause such an offence to be committed, and in such attempt does any act towards the commission of the offence, shall, where no express provision is made by this Sanhita for the punishment of such attempt, be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-half of the imprisonment for life or, as the case may be, one-half of the longest term of imprisonment provided for that offence, or with such fine as is provided for the offence, or with both.
